iti69:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti69:2.1: “Whoever has not given up greed, hate, and delusion
iti69:2.2: is said to have not crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its sharks and monsters.
iti69:2.3: Whoever has given up greed, hate, and delusion
iti69:2.4: is said to have crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its sharks and monsters. Crossed over and gone beyond, that brahmin stands on the shore.”
iti69:2.5: That is what the Buddha said.
iti69:3.1: “Those in whom greed, hate, and ignorance
iti69:3.3: have crossed the ocean so hard to cross,
iti69:3.4: with its sharks and monsters, its waves and dangers.
iti69:4.1: They’ve escaped their chains, given up death, and have no attachments.
iti69:4.2: They’ve given up suffering, so there are no more future lives.
iti69:4.3: They’ve come to an end, and cannot be measured;
iti69:4.4: and they’ve confounded the King of Death, I say.”
iti69:5.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
